info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 12 at 8:43PM EDT until July 12 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Madison County in northwestern Virginia... West central Orange County in central Virginia... Greene County in central Virginia... South central Culpeper County in northern Virginia... * Until 930 PM EDT. * At 843 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Madison to near Free Union, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Orange, Madison, Stanardsville, Ruckersville, Brightwood, Quinque, Eheart, Oakpark, Haneytown, Newtown, Madison Mills, Montford, Old Somerset, Amicus, Somerset, Shady Grove, Hood, Locust Dale, Rapidan and Pratts. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
